Instin functions reference¶

This page contains the details of each instin.py function.

instin.close_term(IP, PORT)¶

This reboots the gateway

Parameters

  • IP (str) – Gateway’s IP

  • PORT (int) – TCP port

Return type

None

instin.fillp2(path)¶

Auxiliary function for file transfer.

Expands the file of the input path to have a size multiple of 512

Parameters

path (str) – Input file path

Return type

int

Returns

The new input file lenght

instin.open_inst(IP, PORT, VISA)¶

For opening instruments in the Gateway.

The instrument whose VISA address is VISA is opened in the Gateway The IP and the PORT are needed as always. An example of VISA address: USB0::0x0957::0x179B::MY51250760::INSTR

Parameters

  • IP (str) – Gateway’s IP

  • PORT (int) – TCP port

  • VISA (str) – Instrument’s VISA address

Return type

int

Returns

The integer identifier the Gateways has associated to the instrument.

instin.query(IP, PORT, InstID, command)¶

To send SCPI commands and wait for an answer

Parameters

  • IP (str) – Gateway’s IP

  • PORT (int) – TCP port

  • InstID (int) – Integer identifier the Gateway associated to the instrument when it was opened with open_inst

  • command (str) – SCPI command to send to the Gateway

Return type

str

Returns

The string answered by the instrumentation when sending the selected SCPI command.

instin.send_program(IP, PORT, NAME_IN, *NAMEs_OUT)¶

Can be used to send an entire program to the Gateway.

This enables the standalone mode, where all the measurement orders are coded in a program that is sent to the Gateway and launched. The host waits for receiving the files with the results of the measurement.

Parameters

  • IP (str) – Gateway’s IP

  • PORT (int) – TCP port

  • NAME_IN (str) – The name of the file with the program to be sent to the Gateway

  • *NAMEs_OUT – Name(s) of the file(s) that are going to be generated by the NAME_IN program and sent to the host

Return type

None

instin.sincro(IP, PORT)¶

Sends the time to the Gateway.

Sends time.strftime('%m%d%H%M.%S') to the Gateway in the IP through the PORT.

Parameters

  • IP (str) – Gateway’s IP

  • PORT (int) – TCP port

Return type

None

instin.write(IP, PORT, InstID, command)¶

To send SCPI commands without waiting for an answer.

Parameters

  • IP (str) – Gateway’s IP

  • PORT (int) – TCP port

  • InstID (int) – Integer identifier the Gateway associated to the instrument when it was opened with open_inst

  • command (str) – SCPI command to send to the Gateway

Return type

None
